sub_title: Building Data Products at Scale | Agile evangelist | Leadership
summary:
Jinto Jose is a data driven, results-oriented professional with 14 years of total work experience in real-world projects in data lake, business intelligence, data warehouse, advanced analytics reporting, and application development. Jinto is an MBA graduate from Amsterdam Business School and a certified product owner with expertise in leading the full software development life cycle in an agile environments. He is a passionate Agile evangelist and took the lead in the agile transformation of the BI teams at his workplaces. At one of his previous employers he took initiatives to introduce Agile to the senior management by organizing company visits at ING. Key words include, but are not limited to: strong leadership, analytical, decision making and communication skills working well both independently, as well as in team setting.

Deep hands on experience in end to end data solutions (data integration, solution design, functional design, data management, data modelling, data migration, data quality, data cleansing, data governance, meta data reporting, data archiving, reporting, reporting environments, and analytics). Jinto brings experiences from the banking, finance, commodity trading, oil and gas, CRM, and logistics industry.  Jinto is a people person with strong relationship management and team management skills. He enjoys working in challenging environments where he can develop and use technology to leverage strategies and provide better solutions to clients. 

Jinto’s recurrent competencies are agility, leadership, and data fluency. He thrives when picking up new challenges/responsibility, during transformations, in a crisis, and when executing strategic vision. 

You can ask me about:
--------------------------
Leadership  
Data Products 
Building teams - from Voluntary Org to Big enterprises 
Agile
Tools
Productivity Hacks
Thinking in Fibonacci Rhythms
Visualizing Data 
Time management 
Delivering on tight timelines  
Solutions - from Excel to Rocket engines  

------------------------------------

The best way to reach me is to email me at jinto.m.jose@gmail.com. I will respond within 24 hours.

projects.title: IoT Business Case - Avanade Case Study Challenge 2015 - Team Mentor/Coach
projects.description:
As part of the coaching team my responsibilities included twin role. One as an organizer and two as a coach.

As an organizer I made the 3 month general schedule for the teams to follow with clear Goal plan and delivery schedule.
As a Coach I was able to instigate discussions within the interns to filter their findings to actual facts and numbers. I guided them reach their goal by training them to think like a consultant and focus at the end goal. I also instigated them to formulate a strategy for their business plan that is concrete and dummy proof for management team to put into action.

projects.title: Industry Analysis : SMB
projects.description:
My responsibility was to analyse the Small and Medium Business companies in The Netherlands to reach conclusions for developing direct business possibilities for Avanade. The main goals of the analysis was 
1. General report conclusions and recommendations
2. Comparison of company results to peer organizations
3. Personalized recommendations for each company
4. Possible questions looking at the service portfolio offered by Avanade Data and Analytics team.

contributors.headline: Building Data Products at Scale | Agile evangelist | Leadership

projects.title: SCRUM Master/Team Lead Enterprise Data Warehouse Team at Major Oil & Gas Team
projects.description: Served as the SCRUM master and technical consultant to the Smart Solutions Platform (SSP) Enterprise Data warehouse (EDWH) team. Jinto was responsible for the SSP EDWH services delivery and managed the globally distributed SCRUM team that included both offshore resources (India) and onshore resources (NL). He was recognized by the customer for his SCRUM expertise and team management skills that he exhibited – rigorously planning the capacity, working towards the delivery and ensuring the team is motivated to become a high performing team whilst maintaining high quality standards. He is featured in the Shell Global magazine in the August 2015 edition on his SCRUM expertise. Key responsibilities also included ETL quality control through inspection process, data model and SSIS server deployments using automated deployments from TFS, maintain the technical design documents and integration design documents, TFS branch ownership, and ETL development.

contributors.headline: Building Data Products at Scale | Agile evangelist | Leadership

projects.title: Developer Enterprise Data Warehouse at Major Oil & Gas company, The Hague area.
projects.description: Served as a technical business intelligence consultant to the  Enterprise Data Warehouse team within a major Oil & Gas Company. Collaborated with various others teams within the company, namely operations, business teams, data modelers to ensure the services of EDWH are delivered on time and technically par excellent. He also ensured that the services offered by EDWH are always available, improved the end to end testing process, and source control process of code delivered. Together with the team Jinto also implemented an automated release pipeline that enabled a continuous delivery process and saved the client 800+ hours of deployment time per year. Key responsibilities included ETL development and maintenance, SSIS testing, and automating the release pipeline using custom made TFS extensions and Nolio.

contributors.headline: Building Data Products at Scale | Agile evangelist | Leadership

projects.title: Big Data Business Case - Avanade Case Study Challenge - Organising Team and Intern Coach
projects.description: The ACSC is an internship program launched by Avanade for MBA & master level students, challenging them to solve a real life business case. Jinto coached and managed two teams of business interns during two consecutive years. He was also responsible for marketing the business challenge in the selected academic institutions, interviewing and selecting the candidates, as well as providing a technical overview for the cases. The combination of technical and business knowledge that Jinto possess, enabled the interns to deliver high quality results and added value for Avanade.

contributors.headline: Building Data Products at Scale | Agile evangelist | Leadership

projects.title: Big Data Management at TomTom (MBA Project)
projects.description:
Company Project (Thesis) Final Grade: A-, 8 on Dutch grading scale 

Explore the idea of linking Big Data analysis to the strategy analysis tools – see how they fit or not fit in a particular business case, and come up with suggestions for adjustments. Also try to develop a Big Data strategy analysis tool / product in the process. 

•	Linking Big Data analysis to strategy analysis tools and frameworks.
•	Recommending new market expansion strategies for TomTom through Big Data management.
•	Developing a Big Data strategy analysis tool/ product in the process.
•	Analysing market, competitors and customers to formulate new strategies to increase the market share of TomTom products.

projects.title: The Formation Project
projects.description: The formation project of Jesus Youth Chennai was to build the leadership, lifestyle and core values of individuals who are in second level leadership to a higher first level of leadership. The main challenge of the project was to tap the potential of people with various skills and make them work together for a common goal. The project spanned over 8 months with weekend training sessions and month long specific target work. The success of the project can be seen in the widespread fame and adaptation of the project plan over various parts of the world.

profile_positions.description:
As a Product Area Lead I am responsible for part of the tribe's business purpose. I steer Product Area in terms of delivering the purpose (the ‘what’) . I work together with the squads’ Product Owners in the Product Area concerned and is also the Asset Owner of my assets. My responsibilities are broad and varied, such as shaping and prioritizing digitalization and operational performance management data demands with stakeholders, co-developing data management strategy, resolving cross-tribe impediments, leading PO family meetings, marketplaces, etc. Together with Tribe Lead/CDO we determine where and how I can add the most value to the tribe, based on my personal strengths.

As senior leader, I define future of data management and insights in data driven channels and sales operations. My role is to take lead in creating a vision how we can increase our income, decrease our cost and improve customer experience with data, insights and digitalisation. This is core fundament of our data offensive strategy to monetize our data for benefit of our customers and ING.
profile_positions.title: Product Area Lead Data Management
Product Area Lead & Chapter Area lead

profile_positions.description:
In my current role, I am responsible for the delivery of salesforce data to all the user groups in Domestic Bank NL, BE.

Develop a product vision together with stakeholders and with my squad.
Define requirements with the stakeholders (data stewards, data users):
 - The data to be on-boarded into the data lake.
 - The data to be provided from the data lake.
 - The requirements on data quality, data privacy, data security, and other relevant aspects of the data.
Prioritize the product backlog by defining road maps in “Quarterly Business Reviews”, by aligning in “Marketplaces” with senior management and other product owners of the Tribe, and by consulting with several departments of ING Group.
Assess the feasibility of the proposed solutions. Evaluate the user experiences with the developed solutions and define proposals for improvement.
Secure the operational performance of the assets which are delivered and maintained by my squad. 
 Define and prioritize the operational requirements and organize with my squad the operational tasks to be completed.
Support and coach others on data management, for example, data stewards in the business domains, and stimulate the organization to grow towards a ‘data-driven’ organization.
Continuously take the initiative to improve the way of work and the collaboration within my squad. 
Frequently align with the Agile Coach, the Chapter Leads, the IT Area Lead, and other product owners.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner Data Management

profile_positions.description:
In the role of Product Owner, I am responsible for the full software development life cycle in an agile environment from requirement gathering, planning to deployment and further. As a Product Owner, I work side by side within multidisciplinary team of developers, QA and IT specialists removing obstacles, improving efficiency and collaboration. It is crucial in my role that I have the ability to safeguard a clear planning and I take the responsibility to deliver according the planning. 
I am in charge for documenting the needs of the Business Sponsor and working with cross-functional teams to optimize delivery of our data product. I ensure that the team is aware of the processes. I work very closely together with the other Product Owners to be the bridge between various stakeholders within the organization. 

Responsible to drive product strategy & development include, but are not limited to: 
•	Identify and collect requirements from internal/ business stakeholders 
•	Create clear user stories and functional requirements needed to enhance our products 
•	Initiate and follow up on the decision making processes 
•	Be first point of contact for product related questions and if needed delegate accordingly 
•	Active and effective collaboration with several teams within the company (e.g. development, analysts, QA, product sponsors) 
•	Analyze product life-cycle and prioritize the requirements accordingly 
•	Responsible for team- and support planning 
•	Warrant timely delivery 
•	Keep stakeholders up-to-date on priorities and progress of products 
•	Manage and safeguard projects, covering all project phases within the organization 
•	Make sure the right priorities are being worked on
profile_positions.title: Product Owner Data, Analytics & Reporting

profile_positions.description: Leading change in Business Intelligence at Glencore Agriculture B.V. Working with stakeholders and business sponsors to identify and collect requirements, draft them into clear user stories, ensure good refinement takes place, order the backlog and ensure the team works as a self-organizing team delivering potentially releasable products every sprint. Keep the stakeholders updated to ensure their priorities are taken into consideration.

volunteer_experiences.description:
Jesus Youth is an International Catholic Youth Movement of young vibrant Christians that has a passionate heart for each and every human being. The focus of the movement is to build a lifestyle based on values of Jesus.

I was the coordinator (president) for the movement during my college days. While working as a full time employee I found time for the activities and was coordinator (president) at the city of Chennai with a responsibility of over 250 people and other activities of the movement . I am still a part of it and currently am an invited member to the European team.

I teach catechism on Sundays to children aged 11 to 12 at church. I feel great joy in being part of the lives of kids and in raising them. I am an education enthusiast and I desire to use its power to change lives in places where they are not available.

volunteer_experiences.role: Program Team Assistant Coordinator - Jesus Youth Fulltimers
